page.title: 08THE CARAVAN PARK
page.content: The caravan park covering 24 acres is near Dobbs Weir, Hoddesdon. The park is on an island, with the River Lea on one side and the River Lynch on the other. It has been open since 1950 and is owned by Lea Valley Regional Authority. The caravan park is open from Easter to October, with August the most popular month. The park will hold 100 static caravans and 100 touring caravans. Tents are also allowed. There are 6 metres of space between each caravan. The caravan park has toilets, showers, a laundry and special facilities for the disabled. Touring caravans pay Â£1.80 per person per night. Static caravans pay Â£360 per year. Mr. Bland is the manager. He has to manage the park, see it is kept clean and arrange to have the grass cut. He has an assistant in summer. It is a very pleasant site.
